summary: This is an email from an unidentified sender to Audrey Strauss, the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, attaching a draft 'cheat sheet' for an upcoming event. The document outlines the legal charges against Ghislaine Maxwell, including perjury specifications and notes on statutes of limitations, and clarifies that she is not charged with the sex trafficking statute that was used against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of an email containing a draft 'cheat sheet' outlining legal charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the legal cheat sheet, which details perjury charges and clarifies she is not charged with Epstein's sex trafficking statute.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the individual who was charged with a sex trafficking statute, which is noted as not applying to Maxwell's charges.

connections.description: Maxwell's charges are discussed in relation to Epstein's prior sex trafficking charges, indicating their legal and operational connection.
Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is receiving legal briefing materials pertaining to the prosecution of Maxwell.

events.title: Drafting of Legal Cheat Sheet
events.description: An unidentified sender emails U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss a first draft of a 'cheat sheet' for an upcoming event, detailing charges against Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is a preparatory legal email from June 29, 2020, sent to U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.
It contains a draft 'cheat sheet' outlining the specific perjury charges and the applicable statute of limitations for Ghislaine Maxwell.
It explicitly notes that Maxwell is not charged with the same sex trafficking statute that was used against Jeffrey Epstein.
